title: ICE: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/subst.rs:538:17: type parameter `T/#2` (T/2) out of range when substituting, substs=[FreshTy(0), [type error]]

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust trait Foo {} fn eq() { eq:: } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.55.0-nightly (6d820866a 2021-06-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: 6d820866a27b1949e237be79b9c8c0145fe728b7 commit-date: 2021-06-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.55.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` error[E0403]: the name `T` is already used for a generic parameter in this item's generic parameters --> mutant.rs:1:14 | 1 | trait Foo {} | - ^ already used | | | first use of `T` error[E0412]: cannot find type `dyn` in this scope --> mutant.rs:3:10 | 2 | fn eq() { | - help: you might be missing a type parameter: `, dyn` 3 | eq:: | ^^^ not found in this scope warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated --> mutant.rs:3:15 | 3 | eq:: | ^^^ help: use `dyn`: `dyn Foo` | = note: `#[warn(bare_trait_objects)]` on by default = warning: this is accepted in the current edition (Rust 2015) but is a hard error in Rust 2021! = note: for more information, see issue #80165 error[E0601]: `main` function not found in crate `mutant` --> mutant.rs:1:1 | 1 | / trait Foo {} 2 | | fn eq() { 3 | | eq:: 4 | | } | |_^ consider adding a `main` function to `mutant.rs` error[E0107]: missing generics for trait `Foo` --> mutant.rs:3:15 | 3 | eq:: | ^^^ expected at least 1 generic argument | note: trait defined here, with at least 1 generic parameter: `T` --> mutant.rs:1:7 | 1 | trait Foo {} | ^^^ - help: add missing generic argument | 3 | eq::> | ^^^^^^ error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/subst.rs:538:17: type parameter `T/#2` (T/2) out of range when substituting, substs=[FreshTy(0), [type error]] --> mutant.rs:3:15 | 3 | eq:: | ^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/6d820866a27b1949e237be79b9c8c0145fe728b7/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:952:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.55.0-nightly (6d820866a 2021-06-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `eq` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies end of query stack error: aborting due to 5 previous errors; 1 warning emitted Some errors have detailed explanations: E0107, E0403, E0412, E0601. For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0107`. ```
Backtrace

cannot find type `dyn` in this scope --> mutant.rs:3:10 | 2 | fn eq() { | - help: you might be missing a type parameter: `, dyn` 3 | eq:: | ^^^ not found in this scope warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated --> mutant.rs:3:15 | 3 | eq:: | ^^^ help: use `dyn`: `dyn Foo` | = note: `#[warn(bare_trait_objects)]` on by default = warning: this is accepted in the current edition (Rust 2015) but is a hard error in Rust 2021! = note: for more information, see issue #80165 error[E0601]: `main` function not found in crate `mutant` --> mutant.rs:1:1 | 1 | / trait Foo {} 2 | | fn eq() { 3 | | eq:: 4 | | } | |_^ consider adding a `main` function to `mutant.rs` error[E0107]: missing generics for trait `Foo` --> mutant.rs:3:15 | 3 | eq:: | ^^^ expected at least 1 generic argument
